Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Elena Torres. I'm 21 and majoring in Marketing.
Hello, Elena! Great to meet you. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit embarrassed, actually. I had my first group presentation yesterday, and I forgot some key points.
I'm sorry to hear that. Presentations can be intense. How did your classmates react?
One of my teammates, Emma, laughed a bit when I forgot. It made me feel really self-conscious.
That sounds hurtful. It's tough to feel sidelined during something as important as a presentation. How are you processing that experience?
I'm frustrated and starting to question if I'm cut out for this major. I thought I was confident.
Hey again. I'm feeling more anxious now. It's hard for me to participate in group discussions.
It's good to see you again, Elena. What's been happening since our last conversation?
After the presentation, I've been withdrawing from group chats and discussions. I talked to my friend Kevin about feeling like I don't belong.
It's really important that you're reaching out to your friends about how you feel. It can help maintain those connections. How did Kevin respond?
He tried to encourage me, but it's hard not to feel like I'm just not good enough.
Those feelings are common after a setback. Have you thought about ways to ease back into participating more actively?
I've been really overwhelmed as midterms approach. I'm struggling to stay motivated.
I appreciate you coming back, Elena. What concerns are weighing on you as midterms get closer?
I feel lost and think about dropping the marketing club. I'm scared of failing in front of everyone.
It's understandable to feel overwhelmed. Have you had a chance to talk to anyone about your studies and anxiety about performance?
I've only talked to my family, but I feel trapped in my negative thoughts. I can't seem to shake them off.
It's often challenging to escape those thoughts. What if you set smaller, achievable goals for your study sessions?
Hi, I've made a decision. I want to reach out to my professor and talk about my concerns.
That's a constructive choice, Elena! What do you hope to achieve from that conversation?
I want to express how anxious I am and seek support for the group project.
That sounds like a solid plan. How are you feeling about initiating this conversation with your professor?
I'm nervous but also hopeful. I realize I can't tackle this alone.
It takes courage to ask for help, and doing so can empower you. Remember, your feelings are valid.
Thank you! I appreciate your encouragement. I'll keep you updated on how it goes.
You're welcome, Elena! I look forward to hearing from you. Best of luck!
